@Cavalcadewhimsy I honestly don‚Äôt think ADHD (have taken good look at criteria and don‚Äôt meet - the dyspraxia one is another story ;). I would have to pay for a private dyspraxia assessment and I‚Äôm not sure what I‚Äôd gain from it.

@Cavalcadewhimsy It‚Äôs interesting because I‚Äôm not diagnosed ND (though son is, so makes more likely). Physio certain I‚Äôm dyspraxic and newish friend (psychologist) said she wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if I have ADHD traits. That was unsolicited so bit weird of her and pinch of salt.

@Cavalcadewhimsy Pen-chewing makes me nod in recognition. During my O levels I chewed pencils down to stubs and was covered in splinters. Thankfully 6th form let me chew gum, though my jaw ached for weeks after my A levels. ü§£

@Cavalcadewhimsy I too doodle in meetings and got in huge trouble for this at school. By year 10 I was doing a kind of self-taught mind-map-ish note-taking affair. This did not go down well with my history teacher who sent me to head of year. He backed me up.
